Pre-Game Insights: The San Antonio Spurs (16-15, ninth in the Western Conference) will face the Minnesota Timberwolves (16-14, eighth in the Western Conference) in a Western Conference game.
The Timberwolves are 13-9 in Western Conference games and average 109.2 points per game, outscoring opponents by 2.1 points per game.
The Spurs are sixth in the Western Conference with 33.9 defensive rebounds per game led by Victor Wembanyama averaging 8.3.

The Timberwolves score 109.2 points per game, 2.8 fewer points than the 112.0 the Spurs allow, and the Spurs are shooting 45.6% from the field, 0.2% lower than the 45.8% the Timberwolves' opponents have shot this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Edwards is averaging 25.3 points, 5.5 rebounds, and four assists for the Timberwolves.
Chris Paul is averaging 9.6 points and 8.2 assists for the Spurs.
The Timberwolves have 6-4 in their last 10 games, averaging 105.6 points, 44.6 rebounds, 26.4 assists, 10.0 steals, and 4.9 blocks per game, shooting 44.6% from the field.
The Spurs are 5-5 in their last 10 games, averaging 113.1 points, 45.0 rebounds, 29.5 assists, 7.6 steals, and 8.1 blocks per game, shooting 46.0% from the field.
Others: Daishen Nix and Luka Garza for the Timberwolves are day to day due to ankle injuries, while the Spurs have no injuries listed.
